transcript.text: shabbat shalom this is Daniel John Lee
with Torah restoration ministries it is
getting close to the end of the Sabbath
day here on the west coast it is the
second day of the tenth month almost the
third day the tenth month were getting
very very close now to the end of
Hanukkah and so I thought I would read a
psalm that I think is perfect for
Hanukkah because it's actually a psalm
and a song that was written at the
dedication of the house of Yahweh and of
course Hanukkah is a celebration when
the Maccabees after they had overcome
the possible odds and driven back the
Greeks they rededicated the temple after
they had cleansed it and so I thought
I'd go to Scripture and find a scripture
about what happened at another
dedication of the temple which was when
Solomon finally dedicated this house
that that his father of course had
wantin wanted built for Yahweh and his
father David was able to gather all the
materials and get all the gold and
silver and all the stone and timber
together but wasn't actually able to
build it Solomon built it and this is a
song that was that was dedicated for
written for that dedication it says I
will extol thee O Yahweh for you have
lifted me up and you have not made my
foes to rejoice over me o Yahweh my
Elohim I cried unto you and you have
healed me
o Yahweh you have brought up my soul
from the grave you have kept me alive
that I should not go down to the pit
sing unto Yahweh oh you Saints of his
and give thanks at the remembrance of
his holiness for his anger endures but a
moment in his favor his life weeping may
endure for a night but joy comes in the
morning and in my prosperity I said I
shall never be moved yahweh by your
favor you have made my mountain to stand
strong you did hide your face and i was
troubled i cried to you o Yahweh and
then the Yahweh I made supplication
what profit is there in my blood when I
go down to the pit shall the dust praise
you shall declare your truth hero Yahweh
and have mercy upon me away be thou my
helper you have turned for me my
mourning into dancing and you have put
off my sack cloth and curtain me with
gladness to the end of my glory may sing
praise to you and not be silent o Yahweh
my looking I will give thanks unto you
forever and ever hallelujah
Psalm 30 given at the dedication of the
house of David shabbat shalom
